bug.author: caraffi
bug.summary: Precompiled header: created and used with different settings of -fpic
bug.description: OpenCV 3.1 Cross compiling Windows->android Using android-ndk-r10e (32bit) Standalone toolchain gcc 4.9 targeting API19 Enabling precompiled headers Building static libraries (also applies for shared libraries) Building using ninja, and defining environment variable ANDROID_STANDALONE_TOOLCHAIN A long list of warnings like the following are displayed: cc1plus.exe: warning: /OpenCV3_1/opencv/build_android/modules/features2d/test_precomp.hpp.gch/opencv_test_features2d_Release.gch: created and used with different settings of -fpic

comments.comment: With mingw/gcc 4.9.2 Windows->Windows 32bit, I get instead (basically for every file compiled) the warning: warning: -fPIC ignored for target (all code is position independent). This only applies for building static libraries, there's no issue when building shared libraries.
Precompiled headers feature is disabled in case of any cross-compilation
Do you mean from now on? Because the behaviour I tested is that while cross compiling the precompiled header are enabled by default in the cmake gui.

Clear CMake cache (CMakeCache.txt) or disable ENABLE_PRECOMPILED_HEADERS=OFF. Change is added <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/commit/c8ff7a486735f45f9dd4060111b71957c78142c6#diff-af3b638bc2a3e6c650974192a53c7291>here</denchmark-link>
